Breeding adult.description: Western Sandpipers have a bigger head and a heavier-bodied look than Semipalmated Sandpipers. In breeding plumage, Westerns often have brighter rusty upperparts, a whiter face, and chevron markings on the flanks that Semipalms lack.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Western Sandpipers have a bigger head, a heavier-bodied look, and a longer more drooping bill than Semipalmated Sandpipers. Nonbreeding birds tend to be grayer than Semipalmated Sandpipers, which are more brown.

Breeding adult.description: Least Sandpipers are smaller than Semipalmated Sandpipers with yellow (not black) legs.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Least Sandpipers are smaller than Semipalmated Sandpipers with yellow (not black) legs.

Breeding adult.description: Sanderlings are larger than Semipalmated Sandpipers. Breeding Sanderlings have more rusty-colored upperparts than Semipalmated Sandpipers.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Sanderlings are larger than Semipalmated Sandpipers. Nonbreeding Sanderlings are a more frosty gray, with a clean breast, while nonbreeding Semipalmated Sandpipers are brownish with a smudgy and lightly streaked breast.

Juvenile.description: Baird's Sandpipers are larger than Semipalmated Sandpipers. They have longer wings that extend farther beyond the tail than they do on Semipalmated Sandpipers.

Molting adult.description: White-rumped Sandpipers are larger than Semipalmated Sandpipers with a more smudgy and streaked breast. Note more obvious eyebrow on White-rumped Sandpipers than on Semipalmated Sandpipers.
